metadata.title: CVE-2015-8854 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: The marked package before 0.3.4 for Node.js allows attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via unspecified vectors that trigger a "catastrophic backtracking issue for the em inline rule," aka a "regular expression denial of service (ReDoS)."

criterions.comment: node-marked package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.3.9+dfsg-1').
